overview: Traditionally nomadic shepherds, the Aromanian or Vlach people are an ethnic group with a Latin-based language who can be found in different parts of the Balkans. CÁIMÒ, meaning ‘BITTER REGRET’, follows one of the few remaining Aromanian families still living in a village in eastern Macedonia.
tagline: I see. I hear. I say nothing.
title: Caimo: Bitter Regret
